title: Collaborative Learning-Based Educational System Design for Improving K-12 Students’ Mathematics Achievement: Strengthening Computational·Problem-Solving·Proof Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of teaching-learning theories, understanding of collaborative learning concepts, basic math concepts (equations, functions, statistics, proofs, etc.), experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Enhancing system design capabilities for pre-service teachers immediately applicable to K-12 mathematics education settings: particularly focusing on improving students' computational skills, problem-solving abilities, mathematical reasoning, and proof skills. Emphasizes collaborative learning strategies and digital resource integration applicable in actual classroom environments

learning_goals: Propose ≥3 math lesson designs applying collaborative learning principles (team-based problem solving, peer teaching) with concrete activities (equation solving, graph analysis, statistics projects) and mathematical reasoning processes

Identify ≥90% of reliable influencing factors in educational system design (learning environment, problem-solving time, teacher mathematical competency, formula application accuracy, student interaction frequency)

Within three weeks, learners design one blended learning module integrating interactive equation editors and auto-grading systems using digital tools (Google Jamboard, Notion), achieving ≥80% functional completeness via peer/teacher verification (module must include calculation exercises, graph visualization, statistical analysis)

Learners analyze school-community linkage program cases and evaluate frameworks with comprehensive scores ≥80/100 based on six criteria (educational effectiveness, community contribution, sustainability, computational skill improvement, problem-solving enhancement, mathematical expression)

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (Padlet, Google Workspace, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
